page.title: 05VERULAMIUM PARK
page.content: {Verulamium Park}is one of the most popular recreational areas in St Albans. It contains two lakes which were excavated partly to provide work for some of the unemployed from the North during the Depression of 1930 - 1934. In the larger of the lakes there are two islands which provide something of a bird sanctuary for the many ducks, geese and swans which abound. The park includes cricket and football pitches and tennis courts. Sometimes a fair visits the park on August Bank Holidays. Much of the park covers what used to be the old Roman city of{Verulamium}and parts of the wall of that city can still be seen there. Overlooking the park is the { {Cathedral and Abbey Church of St {Alban. }
